ðŸ’¡ retroassembly | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Playing retro games in a browser-based environment, either through the official hosted version or by self-hosting with Docker.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Play retro games in the browser â€¢ Automatic box art and cover detection â€¢ Save and synchronize game progress â€¢ Rewind gameplay (some emulators) â€¢ Spatial navigation
ðŸ“– Summary: RetroAssembly is a web-based retro game collection cabinet that allows users to play classic games from various consoles directly in their browser. It features automatic box art detection, save synchronization, rewind functionality (for some emulators), spatial navigation, visual enhancements via shaders, and on-screen virtual controllers.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ vibetest-use | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Automated QA testing of websites for UI bugs, broken links, and accessibility issues.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Automated QA testing â€¢ Browser-Use agents â€¢ MCP server â€¢ UI bug detection â€¢ Broken link detection
ðŸ“– Summary: The Vibetest Use repository provides an automated QA testing solution for websites using Browser-Use agents. It includes an MCP server that launches multiple agents to identify UI bugs, broken links, accessibility issues, and other technical problems, suitable for both live and local development environments.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ zee | Rust
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Terminal-based text editing and code development.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ 100 FPS editor with asynchronous operations â€¢ Rope-based buffer implementation (using ropey) â€¢ Edit tree history (undo/redo tree) â€¢ Tree-sitter for syntax highlighting and validation â€¢ Multi-buffer, multi-pane support
ðŸ“– Summary: Zee is a modern, experimental text editor for the terminal written in Rust, inspired by Emacs. It emphasizes performance, aiming for 100 FPS rendering with asynchronous operations for tasks like syntax highlighting and file I/O. It uses Tree-sitter for incremental parsing, supports multi-buffer editing, and offers features like fuzzy file search and a rope-based buffer implementation.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ discordo | Go
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Accessing and interacting with Discord through a terminal interface.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Lightweight â€¢ Configurable â€¢ Mouse & clipboard support â€¢ Attachments â€¢ Notifications
ðŸ“– Summary: Discordo is a lightweight, secure, and feature-rich terminal-based Discord client. It aims to provide a configurable and efficient way to access Discord through a terminal user interface, supporting features like attachments, notifications, and 2-Factor authentication.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ blurr | Kotlin
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Automating tasks on Android devices using natural language commands.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Intelligent UI Automation using Android Accessibility Service â€¢ High-quality voice using GCS's Chirp â€¢ Multi-agent system architecture written in Kotlin â€¢ LLM-powered reasoning and planning
ðŸ“– Summary: The repository provides an AI agent named Panda for Android that can autonomously understand natural language commands and operate a phone's UI. It uses the Android Accessibility Service to interact with the device and LLMs for high-level reasoning and planning, enabling automation of complex, multi-step tasks across different applications.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ protector | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Real-time privacy protection for smart glasses applications.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Anonymizes faces (blur or solid ellipse masking) â€¢ Manages consent (voice detection) â€¢ Real-time processing (720p 30fps) â€¢ 100% offline operation â€¢ Recording
ðŸ“– Summary: The repository provides a real-time privacy protection layer for smart glasses applications. It filters camera input, anonymizes faces, manages consent through voice detection, and outputs a compliant video stream. This allows developers to build privacy-conscious AI, social, and enterprise applications using smart glasses.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source
